means: 紧握，抓紧，咬紧( clench的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He hammered his two clenched fists on the table.
sentence.Network_cn: 他双拳紧握，重重地捶着桌子。

sentence.Network_en: Slowly, he released his breath through clenched teeth.
sentence.Network_cn: 他从紧咬的牙缝间慢慢地舒了口气。

sentence.Network_en: Alex clenched her fists and gritted her teeth.
sentence.Network_cn: 亚历克丝攥紧拳头，牙咬得咯咯响。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 鲜血与荣耀 | 爱酷英语|iCoolEN ... raise: 升起 clenched: 紧握的 fist: 拳头.
the boy clenched his fists , ready to defend himself ., 小男孩攥紧拳头 , 准备保护自己.
The boy clenched his fists in anger ., 那男孩愤怒地握紧了拳头.
The girl clenched her money in her hand ., 小女孩把钱牢牢抓在手中.

entry.def: When you clench your fist or your fist clenches, you curl your fingers up tightly, usually because you are very angry.

example.ex: Alex clenched her fists and gritted her teeth...
example.tran: 亚历克丝攥紧拳头，牙咬得咯咯响。

example.ex: She pulled at his sleeve and he turned on her, fists clenching again before he saw who it was.
example.tran: 她拉了拉他的袖子，他双拳再次握紧，气冲冲地转过身来，这才发现是她。

entry.tran: (通常指生气、不安时)咬紧(牙齿)，咬牙切齿
entry.def: When you clench your teeth or they clench, you squeeze your teeth together firmly, usually because you are angry or upset.

example.ex: Patsy had to clench her jaw to suppress her anger...
example.tran: 帕奇只得咬紧牙关压住怒气。

example.ex: Slowly, he released his breath through clenched teeth.
example.tran: 他从紧咬的牙缝间慢慢地舒了口气。

entry.def: If you clench something in your hand or in your teeth, you hold it tightly with your hand or your teeth.

example.ex: I clenched the arms of my chair.

auth_sentence.content: Now he stood, clenched and unclenched his fists.

auth_sentence.content: Ensure your buttocks are firm but not clenched.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ensure your buttocks are firm but not clenched.
